result.execSummary:
The defendant Sherry A. Fuller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 15CF119 and consecutive to any other sentences.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling per agent.  No possession of any controlled substances w/out a valid Rx.  Report Rx to agent within 2 working days.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherry A. Fuller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Cover Letter from Robert E. Ellsworth Correctional
from court reporter to DCI records

Defendant Sherry A. Fuller in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Sherry A. Fuller in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  Count 2 dismissed read in.  State gives recommendation.  Attorney Klopp agrees.  Defendant and understands.  No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Attorney Klopp makes final statement.  Defendant makes final statement.  Court imposes sentence.
WI State Prison for 11 years (3 years Initial Confinement/8 years Extended Supervision)  Concurrent to each other, consecutive to any other sentence.  259 days credit.
DNA surcharge $250/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
No possession of any controlled substances w/out a Rx.  Advise agent of Rx within 2 working day.
$1158.00 fine/costs, $250.00 DNA surcharge and $472.50 drug surcharge & Supervision Fees
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Earned Release
Paperwork handed in court.

Court states case.  Ryan states appearances.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sherry A. Fuller in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Sherry A. Fuller in custody.  Court addresses Masana; Motion pending.  Masana responds; provides history/status, requests a signature bond, addresses Fuller's current medical condition, proposed living arrangements and other family member's medical issues.  Ryan responds; argues medical issue while incarcerated and options that exist, State opposes bond modification request.  Masana responds; addresses Fuller's medical issue.  Court rules as follows:  Request for bond modification is denied, bond stands as currently set.  Matter will be reconsidered if further motion is brought as far as treatment/diagnosis appointment for a sort term to allow for medical appointment/treatment.

Defendant Sherry A. Fuller in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Sherry A. Fuller in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Masana advises of waiver today.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.

Defendant Sherry A. Fuller in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Sherry A. Fuller in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Requests preliminary hearing.  Time limits continued waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Return date at 06-02-2015 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 05-22-2015 09:45 am.

Defendant Sherry A. Fuller in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Sherry A. Fuller in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is not resolved.  Request PTC/RD.  Awaiting further discovery.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 04-17-2015 09:00 am.
Return date at 04-29-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Sherry A. Fuller appeared by video means with Attorney Tsai. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Defendant does qualify.  State gives criminal history.  Time limits waived. $20,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  May not leave the State of WI and not possess any controlled substances.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
